Description: Fragment of a tapestry band (single warp threads); Purple and red wool on undyed linen ground; Three running animals are lion, goat and dog (?) within interlocked roundels and cusped borders; Warp: wool, S spun, c.12 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, S spun c.40-55 tpc; Edges cut; Sewing: none survives but upper and lower edges had been turned under and sewn down. One wool and one linen weft thread used together in lion's mane.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, in perspex; Originally sewn as part of a larger textile, probably a garment. Cut and re-used as an applied ornament. Right and left edges cut since finding. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (5.12.1989)
Condition: Medium to poor; linen rotten; stuck to sticky net (date unknown)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
